title: Should pajamas be banned at Logan Airport?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Tampa International Airport jokingly suggested banning pajamas, sparking nationwide discussion about airport attire.
The social media post was meant humorously, reassuring travelers to prioritize comfort while flying.
U.S. Transportation Secretary referenced a campaign promoting civility in travel, amid increased in-flight outbursts.

title: Sullivan’s Castle Island reopens for the 2026 season
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Sullivan's Castle Island reopens Feb. 27 for its 75th season, continuing its spring tradition in South Boston.
Despite a recent Nor’easter, Sullivan's Castle Island will serve hot dogs, lobster rolls, and more starting at 10 a.m. Saturday.
The iconic concession stand, recognized with a James Beard America’s Classics Award, opens daily through November.

title: Court doc: N.H. country club shooter said he chose location to target rich people
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Hunter Nadeau is accused of shooting at a New Hampshire country club, killing one person and wounding two more.
Nadeau allegedly targeted the wealthy at Sky Meadow Country Club, claiming he was tired of 'elites' taking all the money.
Nadeau faces charges including first-degree murder and attempted murder; he's being held without bail after the September incident.

title: Kelsey Fitzsimmons alleges former fiancé broke into her home, stole evidence while she was hospitalized
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Kelsey Fitzsimmons, a North Andover police officer, alleges her former fiancé broke into her home while she was hospitalized.
The fiancé allegedly impersonated Fitzsimmons, accessing her accounts and withdrawing about $5,000, court documents state.
Essex County DA declined to charge the fiancé, which Fitzsimmons's lawyers claim shows prosecutorial leniency and bias.

title: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic while vacationing in Hawaii
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic in Kealakekua, Hawaii, during his vacation.
The clinic, organized by Rich Miano and SAP, featured 50 local high school players.
Maye, Patriots QB and 2025 NFL MVP runner-up, conducted drills and answered questions.

title: How well do you know Matt Damon and Ben Affleck? Take this quiz to find out.
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck have a 40-year friendship starting from their high school days in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
The pair recently participated in a GQ Magazine video, testing their knowledge of each other's lives.
Boston.com has created a quiz focusing on the duo's history, including their origins and current projects.

title: Review & setlist: Conan Gray’s ‘Wishbone’ tour brought a coming-of-age story to TD Garden
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Conan Gray performed at TD Garden on the 'Wishbone' tour, showcasing his fourth studio album with a visual storytelling concert.
The show featured four acts, exploring themes like heartbreak and growth using songs such as 'My World' and 'Vodka Cranberry'.
Audience participation included choosing songs, and Gray embraced his identity with moments like dancing with a rainbow flag.

title: 8 hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on Cape Cod
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eight people were hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning from a boat at MacMillan Pier in Provincetown.
The incident was declared a mass-casualty event due to the number of patients exceeding available ambulances.
A recent blizzard left many areas of Provincetown without power, potentially contributing to the incident.

title: Topsfield massage parlor shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: FeiFei L Spa in Topsfield was shut down over alleged prostitution and human trafficking after a months-long investigation.
A search warrant was executed at the spa by Topsfield Police and federal and local authorities on Wednesday.
Police issued a cease-and-desist order; criminal charges are pending as the investigation remains active.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Columbus Blue Jackets after spending seven seasons with the Bruins.
Coyle helped the Bruins reach the Stanley Cup Final in 2019, playing a crucial third-line role.
Coyle has 42 points in 57 games with the Blue Jackets this season, contributing to their playoff push.
